DOC.HEAD: Drug Counselor Charged with Extortion of Abuser
DOC.TEXT: A drug counselor was arrested on charges of offering an abuser on probation a drug-free jar of urine in exchange for a Mercedes. David Holland, 36, of Maple Shade, N.J., was taken into custody Tuesday on theft and bribery charges after accepting the keys and signing the title to a $28,000 Mercedes provided by investigators tipped off to the alleged offer. Holland, who was freed on $5,000 bail, is a counselor at Consortium, which has a city contract to provide drug-treatment programs. The district attorney's office said Holland told an unidentified 19-year-old on probation for drug possession that he faced a jail term because of his drug-tainted urine. Holland offered a drug-free sample, authorities said. The man, who was required to undergo treatment at Consortium as part of his probation, thought the price was too steep and reported it to his lawyer, who notified the district attorney's office. Investigators put the man in a Mercedes that had been forfeited in drug raids.
